attributes.action: Ban Christmas Advertising  Before the National Remembrance Services
attributes.additional_details:
RETAILERS marketing and advertising shows No respect for the national mood of Remembrance

A point made plain by retailers opening on the day of the funeral of HM Queen Elizabeth ll

Amplified by the introduction of Christmas decorations before the nation Remembers.
attributes.background:
Respect for the Fallen, 

Asking the Gov to introduce a Ban on Christmas markets and Marketing before the National service of Remembrance. 

Permitting the nation to show annual respect before Celebrating Christmas.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about when to start using Christmas in advertising or marketing are a matter for individual retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament.
